snippet.title: Dwellink: War of the Nine | Gameplay Trailer
snippet.description:
40 minutes of gameplay for our upcoming creature collection game Dwellink: War of the Nine 

www.playdwellink.com
www.highpassionstudios.com

Known bugs:

Sound: Due to problems with the audio middleware FMOD many sounds may not be displayed correctly and are off timing-wise. Also, some sounds are simply missing because of the demo status. As for the NPCs, only Randolf has been properly voice acted. All the others are done with AI. We plan on having a mixture of real voice actors and AI voice actors in the final game by using real voice actors for main quests and important persons and AI voice actors for side quests and other NPCs. We used a lot of different voice acting AIs in this prototype and some work better than others. Hildegard, the crazy old lady near the little pond in Vinor, or Balzar the shop owner in front of the temple in Vinor, have very convincing AI voices whereas others are immediately recognizable as AI voices.

Graphics: A lot of the attack VFX are placeholders and therefore may look off (like the toon-shaded tornado attacks for example).

Battle: The animations of the attacks are way too long at the moment and the text speed is too slow. A standard battle should be much quicker. 

Animation: The animations of the NPCs and some of the Dwellers are very basic and will be replaced soon. The NPC animations are in fact AI-generated.
